IT WAS DISCOVERED THAT ONE OF THE 6 BOTTLES HAD A CRACK ON THE SIDE OF BOTTLE CAUSING A SLOW LEAK WHILE THE OTHER 5 BOTTLES HAD LOOSE CAPS CAUSING THE CONTENTS TO SPILL OUT DescribePack: CLOSURE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PLACED IN A PLASTIC BAG INSIDE A TOTE

item.description:
Report X-2023070972

  • City: CARSON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The bottles had loose caps and spilled DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The Package was immediately put inside a lined red tote and processed accordingly by QA personnel.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The damaged bottle leaked from being crushed by the gallon canister, causing the cap to pop off. Only had the inner packing on top and did not block and brace the contents. Absorbent sheets were used for the cleanup and placed in the lined tote with the package. DescribePack: From inspecting the package, there was no visible damage, like a point of impact to indicate any miss handling. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Immediately was bagged and put in the lined tote,

item.title: Report X-2023070829
item.description:
Report X-2023070829

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered leaking when the employee attempted to move it off the conveyer belt and some of the contents spilled on the person's limb. The shipment was then removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container. The excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent materials. The employee notified a manager and was taken care of per the SCMS report filed by the manager . DescribePack: The cap had become separated from one of the bottles allowing leakage to occur. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up by neutral absorbent materials while the rest of the shipment was removed from the discovery site and put into a plastic lined container.

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found by QA during the preload sort and declared damaged. Put inside hazmat liner and red tote to stop spilling. MSDS report obtained by shipper. SCMS was processed. Then taken to the hazmat processing cage and put inside a yellow bin. Total duration 1 hour. DescribePack: The container had a loose cap and spilled. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was immediately taken and put in a lined red hazmat tote and processed by qualified personnel.

item.title: Report X-2023070792
item.description:
Report X-2023070792

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: SANTA MARIA
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: At the beginning of the sort this package came out of a trailer during unload and was placed on a spill tray until QA could retrieve it. When QA retrieved it they put on nitrile gloves, and placed the damaged item in 2 plastic non-haz bags and then into a lined bin. QA took the time to look around the area for any residue to clean it up off the surface(s). Using a cart the damaged package was wheeled over to the QA station in unload. DescribePack: Due to leaks from the items inside the outer box got wet and due to the corrosive nature of the cleaner a hole was created on the side of the package about the size of 2 fists. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manager in the unload put the damaged box onto a spill tray and QA used non-haz bags and also put it into a lined bin for good measure. QA also went a bit further and inspected the surrounding area where the package came out of from the trailer as well as around the spill tray to soak/clean up any remaining residue.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1.X-2023070793 SequenceEvent: Package found soiled and set aside for processing. Damage was segregated from other packages. DescribePack: 4 out of 4 gallons were found to be soiled due to 3 of the 4 having loose caps and leaked inside the box. There was only a minor spill. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Damage was segregated from other packages. 2. X-2023070795 SequenceEvent: Package was found soiled and set aside for processing. Damage was segregated from other packages. DescribePack: 4 out 4 gallons of solution were found soiled due to 3 of 4 having loose caps and leaked inside the box. There was only a minor spill. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Damage was segregated from other packages.

item.title: Report X-2023070785
item.description:
Report X-2023070785

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-06
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package Handler was unloading Hazmat package and powder spilled out of the package and onto the floor. Package Handler notified Management who then called QA. QA and Manager placed leaky hazmat into a hazmat bag and placed hazmat bag into a hazmat tote. Manager and QA then cleaned up powder spill on floor and placed clean up materials in hazmat bag with the package. DescribePack: One of the bags inside the package had a hole and caused hazmat powder to leak out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat Package was placed inside a hazmat bag to stop source of leak. Package Handlers were asked to stay clear of spilled powder on the floor until QA and Manager cleaned up the powder.

item.title: Report X-2023070705
item.description:
Report X-2023070705

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: BLOOMINGTON
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The pail was discovered with most of the liquid out spilled out of the bucket and was inspected with half of the lid off. In house clean up was performed. Package was placed in a drum to stop the pail from leaking more liquid. DescribePack: The pail was 5 gallons with a lid. Upon inspection the lid was coming off causing the liquid to spill out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The pail was placed in a drum to reduce the liquid from spilling out.

item.title: Report X-2023061319
item.description:
Report X-2023061319

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-12
  • City: SAN FRANCISCO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was discovered by a manager at our ramp in San Francisco when it was seen package had staining indicating a leak inside. Package containing UN 3528 was seen to have been strapped to a pallet which had become damaged in transit causing the package to be tilted. Package consisted of a multi layered fibreboard box. Inside this box was a fibreboard divider and an engine placed in a plastic moisture barrier. Absorbent material was not noted by the ramp employees. Due to teh size of the package, it was not able to be placed in a steel salvage container, however the package was isolated at the consignee was contacted for disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023061318
item.description:
Report X-2023061318

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: CARLSBAD
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking on the couriers van upon returning to the ramp. 3rd party vendor was called for the clean up. Remaining contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for shipper disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023060840
item.description:
Report X-2023060840

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiberboard box was found leaking during sort operations at the LAXSRT facility. While investigating the package the spill agent discovered two plastic bottles containing UN1993. The bottles were packaged in plastic bags and had Styrofoam and paper for dunnage. There were no DG markings or paperwork required on the package. It was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023060807
item.description:
Report X-2023060807

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-08T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: ONTARIO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=621687152492 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit Storage ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1993 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0.0 TECH NAME=Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=621687152470 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1993 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether PKG GRP=III SPILLED QTY=0.0 TECH NAME=Propylene Glycol Monomethyl Ether )A fiberboard box was discovered leaking at the ONTR facility. The fiberboard box contained two metal cans inside containing UN1993. The cans were packaged with bubble wrap and inside of plastic bags. This was a multi piece shipment four in total the ramp was able to locate three of the four. This shipment did not have any hazardous material marking or paperwork required for this commodity. The leaking package was placed into a steel salvage package and all three are being held for the FAA.

Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of bnc-15 (un1903) had ben damaged by a sharp object and that one of the poly 1 liter bottle had released 1 liter of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and clean up the release of the product, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060745
item.description:
Report X-2023060745

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-07T15:11:24+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: OAKLAND
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A fiber board box containing a class 3 was found with signs of release at the Oakland facility. The fiber bboard box contained four metal cans packaged with positive lid closures, inside of plastic bags and separated with fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was dented on the side causing the lid to loosen and come off causing it to release it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and will be returned to the sender after an amended declaration has been obtained.
